title: Software Engineering Lecture Notes WS 24/25
text:
Preface
Lecture notes for the course “Software Engineering” at Heidelberg University WS24/25.

title: 1  Introduction
text:
1.1 Chapters

Introduction
Communication in a Project
Requirements Engineering (Communication with the Users)
Design (Communication with Developers)
Quality Management
Evolution
SWE-Process (Summary and Project Management)

title: 2  Communication in a Project
text:
Following topics relate to and determine communication within a project:

Number of participants and their roles in the project
Type of the contractual relationship
Team Organisation: The way developers communicate within the project
Collaborative Coding

title: 3  Requirements Engineering
text:
requirements engineering can be understood as corresponding to the communication with the users / clients. Deals with the following topics

Introduction to communication with users/clients.

Clients and Requirements
Description and specification of requirements
Defining Requirements Engineering
Outcome of Requirements Engineering
Benefit of specification
Complexities of RE

Usage modelling / description

Introductory Example
Introduction
Tasks, Roles, Persona
Domain Data
Functions, UI-Structure
GUI

Documentation Quality

Introduction and Templates
Characteristics and style guide

Usability
Quality assurance with the client

acceptance test
usability test

Quality requirements

Motivation
Quality attributes
QR-description
QR-test

Use-cases (not relevant to the exam)

Description of Uses Cases
Use for system testing

RE procedure

Introduction
Gathering requirements
Specificying requirements

title: 4  Design
text:
Desing can be understood as communication with and wthin the developers. Deals with the following topics:

Introduction to Modelling
Class diagrams
Interaction diagrams (sequence diagrams)
State Diagrams

UML State diagrams
Dialog models

Class design with OOAD

OOAD introduction
OOAD: Analysis Class diagram
OOAD: Design Class Diagram

Design Patterns

Introduction
Creational patterns
Structural patterns
Behavioral patterns

Rationales (Communication of decisions)
Summary of modelling techniques

title: 5  Quality Assurance
text:
Quality: Software satisfies the requirements
topics:

Introduction
Organizational quality assurance
Testing:

Intro
Test-case specification
Black-box component testing
White-box component testing
System testing
Integration testing / overall-component testing

Static testing

Static Analysis
Metrics
Inspection

Analytical Quality assurance at large

title: 6  Evolution
text:
All activities that facilitate re-use and further development. (All activities that take place after the initial development phase)
topics:

Intro
Architecture
Re-use
Further development and change management
DevOps & IT-Governence
Re-engineering

title: 7  SWE Process & Project Management
text:
Making sure that the Software system is developed withing the time money constraints.
topics:

Project management
SWE-process models & methods
